availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky farmer. Virginia native. Married Mary J. Simpson. Father of Francis M. Simpson, Sarah J. Simpson, William W. Simpson, Nathan A. Simpson, Jonathan Simpson, Charles Simpson, and Lynn B. Simpson.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 28. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 92. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Cany, p. 48. “William C. Simpson (1811-1898),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 5054025, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=SIM&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSsr=5521&GRid=5054025& (accessed June 26, 2017).
